We absolutely loved our stay here! Kati was a wonderful host, very kind and responsive. Our trip had some last minute changes and she was flexible and understanding in our check in/out times - we appreciated it so much!
The airbnb itself was so sweet and cozy, us and our dog loved the peaceful, quiet property and watching the chickens and deer! Definitely coming back to this lovely spot next time I'm in town :)

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is so adorable. It was great. It was clean and just perfect for someone on a budget. This was our first Airbnb and Kati made it a great experience. We had trouble with hot water for the shower and she immediately came to help us out. The hut doesnâ€™t have ac but it has plenty of windows for air circulation and she even gave us a fan to use. We also got to see two does which was nice. The wifi was great and the portable bathroom was clean as well. Only cons are the outside shower could use a bit more privacy since it felt like the neighbors could see you. Also the little wall way was bit narrow. Sink inside the hut only had cold water.The parking spot she originally wanted us to park was to narrow for rav4. Even with this conns they felt like you could work around it. Kati really did make our stay great and honestly would love to come back. Plus the bed was amazing to sleep in. Kati is also extremely responsive and did an amazing job accommodating us! Definitely recommend it.

review_text:
If you want to be away from the hustle & bustle from busy, hectic life...then Kati's place is ideal. Living on a farm myself, I felt right at home with her friendly chickens, and beautiful calm quiet surroundings.
advice: when you pull up, your beautifully decorated, lovely art work filled private little hide-away is located FRONT OF the PROPERTY, to the LEFT. Not the building or house right up front or the home in the far back. Just stay L- not hard to find. Thanks Kati for the clean porta-potty!
note: folks, if your wanting hotel-style extras, close to shopping & restaurants, look elsewhere. But if you crave-peace, nature, back to basics...then I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HIDDEN LIL GEMâ€¼ï¸

The kitchen was amazing and huge, and I really appreciated the gas stove! The place has plenty of space.
We loved how easy it was to walk everywhere in downtown. Parking was a little tricky but not bad. The covered parking a couple blocks away was great our last night when it snowed. Also, it was a very easy drive to Purgatory to ski.
Highly recommend!

review_text:
For Durango, this location is perfect. Itâ€™s situated literally steps from the main drag, with walkable access to all the shops and restaurants.
As for the space itself, it was very comfortable, clean, and cozy. All the amenities youâ€™ll need are there, and everything was modern and updated. Trent was very responsive as well.
There are only two â€œconsâ€ I would mention, (and theyâ€™re not deal breakers):
Parking is a little complicated (the reserved spaces are a block or two away), but that comes with the territory when the location is so convenient.
The front steps can be a little treacherous in icy weather, as the gutter empties directly onto them.
Either of these shouldnâ€™t be a major issue unless a member of your party has difficulty walking.
Other than that, a very pleasant experience, and definitely a recommendation from me.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Located in downtown Durango, across from City Hall, and within walking distance to everything that is Main Street Durango- eateries, shopping and the train station! My two teens walked over to the nearby ice-creamery a few times (which is a must try). Reserved parking is a few blocks away. Otherwise, there is metered parking directly in front of the home and free parking across the street at City Hall during designated times.
Contemporary renovations with a beautiful kitchen, plenty of hot water, a comfy separate lounging area to relax with family for games, movie night, or to read a book.
Books and a variety of board games are provided. Standard kitchen amenities, hair care products and dryer, and extra pillows and blankets are available. It is part of an upstairs/downstairs duplex, we were downstairs. The way it is designed you really do not encounter the upstairs tenants although you can lightly hear them walking around.
Trent is excellent at communicating and has a good response time too.
Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely stay again!

Parking is a bit of a pain, but that is not the fault of the owners - Durango has parking meter enforcement that will catch you within 2 minutes of overstaying your meter. Just know that going in.
Beds are on the firm side. Shower is a rain shower head - lovely. Even though youâ€™re right close to downtown, noise is not really a problem at all. Train sounds during the day, churchbells are charming, and good windows keep out most of the rest.
Listing says sleeps six. Six adults in this space would be quite cozy. Our group of four was just fine, however.

review_text: Trent and Lauren's Main Street Retreat was excellent! Located half a block off Main Avenue in Durango, it allowed access to almost everything of note in town, including restaurants, shops, and the Animas River Trail for walking and cycling. The space was spotless and very well equipped for our stay. There was no communication during our stay because it wasn't needed - everything went perfectly with no surprises. Would definitely stay again. Thanks y'all!

Due to my confusion as to our checkout date, we didnâ€™t check out on time. The hosts reached out to us and we had to scramble our afternoon plans but we managed to clear out just as the cleaners were there for the next guest.
My point here is that the hosts were extremely patient, helpful and understanding once they discovered my error.
I heartedly recommend this Airbnb to any couple or single person who is looking for a place to stay in Durango.

Travelling alone, I don't need too many extras, but when I decided to cook dinner the final night, everything I need to prep the meal was there.
Their description indicates it's close to everything downtown. Very true, literally steps away from Main Street, which offers easy walking access to restaurants, shops, chocolate and, of course, the scenic railroad. Durango has lots of outdoor activities available (none of which I did because it was cold and I was lazy), so Robby and Kristen's place can be a good one for 1-2 travelers.
Thanks for letting me visit.

Artfully furnished in an eclectic combination of old and new, Eric's place was perfect for our holiday ski trip. Close enough to walk to food and action, but tucked away enough to see deer in the yard. Loved making our own breakfast in the kitchen area that had everything we needed and eating at the table surrounded by windows w/lots of natural lighting and great views of nature. QUIET! The king-sized bed was uber-comfy and the bathroom was modern w/natural stone tile in tub/shower area. Only regret is not having enough time to hang out on the comfy couch and watch a movie or read a book. Just have to go back! Eric is a SUPER-HELPFUL host w/good taste in coffee...appreciated having enough for that first morning as we had forgotten to bring ours. It's the little things that count.

Eric even left me some tea and coffee to try. Iâ€™ll DEFINITELY be back here when I visit Durango again. 10 out of 10 stars, Iâ€™m still blown away by this stay. Thank you!

This is a very beautiful and peaceful property, nestled among trees, and adjacent to a babbling creek that sets the tone for a zen like experience.
While we've stayed at numerous properties across the country and especially in Durango, this absolutely is set apart.
We spent most of our days busy with various destinations and activities in the area. However, this is truly a place you could stay and relax and never leave for your entire visit. We enjoyed the views, listening to the creek and the elk bugling at night.
Another highlight was the gallery.
I highly recommend scheduling a time to view it. The owners are accomplished artist, and have studied, trained, and taught art across the entire world.
We actually saved our visit to the gallery for our last day and viewing the art was a perfect way complete our trip.
Thank you so much toJohn and Toshiko
for providing this amazing experience!

We LOVED staying at Toshiko and John's cozy and comfortable studio. Yes, Toshiko, the view sitting in the comfy chairs at the picture window is simply breathtaking. We loved sitting there watching and listening to the rushing creek. In fact, we made a point to get up early to drink our coffee at the window and to get home early enough to have a cocktail back in our favorite chairs!
The studio was clean and provided us with everything we needed. Toshiko assured us that we just needed to ask for anything we might need.
The location was perfect - we easily drove to Mesa Verde National Park for our first day - the drive there and back was breathtaking! The following day we spent in and around Durango. We got in a fabulous 2 hour horseback ride with Over the Hill Outfitters that started on the outskirts of Durango and quickly got us up in to the foothills. We successfully went cowboy boot shopping and birded a nearby reservoir, before getting back home to watch the sunset. Perfect!

review_text:
The studio on this property is absolutely beautiful. It had just what we needed to reset and relaxâ€¦. a comfortably firm bed, hot shower, and stunning views. About 15 minutes north of Durango, we were close to everything we wanted to see and do. With such idyllic surroundings, we slept peacefully and had plenty of energy to hike and explore. The property itself felt like something out of a paintingâ€¦. Soft grass, flowers in bloom, that stream running right outside of the studioâ€¦and had several comfortable places to just sit and enjoy nature all around you.
The only thing I should point out is the kitchen, while well equipped otherwise, has only a hot plate for cooking. It didnâ€™t bother us, ( thereâ€™s a restaurant across the road and a small market 5 min away), but if you are planning on doing a lot of cooking on your trip, itâ€™s something to consider.
I cannot recommend this place enough, and hope to return soon.
Thank you John and Toshiko for allowing us to enjoy a small slice of the paradise you have created!

review_text: This is a lovely location. However, it is NOT private. Apparently the grounds are open to various visitors who may come by to view the gallery. These visitors will be walking around the property, including around the outside of the Airbnb. To include the private deck/patio which faces the owners house, as well as the picture window of the Airbnb that faces the river. You see, the gallery is attached to the Airbnb so they have to go in front of the Airbnb. Additionally, there is no direct lighting in the entire Airbnb. If you like to look in a mirror to see your face or possibly put on make-up, forget about it.

name: Semona
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Definitely would recommend to someone who wants a nice quiet stay and enjoy the beautiful outside.
As we pulled in, Toshiko greeted us with smiles and good vibes. She was as happy to see us, as we were to her. She gave us a tour and was willing to answer any questions we had for her. She was very welcoming and friendly to someone who is somewhat new to airbnb.
You have the entire tiny home to yourself. A ton of privacy and everything you need. A kitchen with a fridge and many items you can use to cook breakfast lunch and dinner. She provided an electric kettle and tea for you to use. I was even able to make my morning smoothie with the provided blender.
The bathroom was up to date and gorgeous. Towels and toiletries were provided which was great.
The living area and bed was very comfortable. The fireplace immediately warmed up the entire place.
Your vehicle will be locked inside a gated area which feels very safe. Especially if you have bikes on your vehicle.
Best of all was the window with a view of the mountains and stream. This alone will get me to stay again. View this from inside the home or along side the stream with provided chairs. They even have a hammock if you enjoy that too.
The provided pictures do not do any justice to this home. I saw the pics and then the home in person and was blown away by the choice I made.
I'm sorry but I cannot pick any downsides to this home. Everything was great and well worth it!

Libbyâ€˜s place is small in size, but huge in amenities. The amount of space is great for a couple or an individual traveler. Just as the description the offerings are abundant. The bathroom is clean and Libby provided the basic toiletries and the kitchenette is well stocked with spices, utensils, coffee and tea.
The queen size bed was comfy with clean linen. Thereâ€™s a small creek that runs behind the cabin even though it was dry during our stay. The surrounding area is very quiet since itâ€™s a residential area even though neighbors are spread quite apart. About an eight minute drive to downtown Durango and with plenty of restaurants, cafes, and gift shops.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and can recommend to anyone without any reservation.

review_text: I am traveling from Missoula, Montana to San Miguel de Allende, Mexico and what nailed the reservation for me was having "The Untethered Soul" in her library. Anyone who has that book is a friend of mine. But it was much more!! She has everything a person needs and it's in a perfect space for one person and a small dog! I guess it would be good for a couple too, but I'm one person with a dog! It smells so good. No chemical Tide/Downy stink! All her spices are organic. Himalayan salt. Tea and Coffee. The refrigerator door had so many useful things when having take out or cooking for yourself. I enjoyed the peaceful early morning light and making coffee. The shower head is one of those amazing top end that feels like one is under a waterfall. I wouldn't expect that in a shack! I'd love to come back every year. Loved it! Terry

name: Michelle
rating_info:

August 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place exceeded all expectations. Sitting right on a beautiful little creek with a large private side yard and funky covered space with a wooden porch swing, the outdoor space alone was awesome. (Sitting outside listening to the rain on that tin roof was divine!) The "Bunny Shack" itself is adorable, inside and out. It's positively dripping with character, and Libby's thoughtful decorating with an eye toward comfort and delight is off the charts. It's a tiny space, but thoughtful design and decoration actually make it feel quite large -- and definitely homey. Have you ever been to a rental that has deluxe (sharp!) knives in the kitchen?! From the collection of gourmet teas, coffees + snacks to the ultra comfy bed with rolling storage underneath to the thoughtful book selection and charming artwork, I was delighted to stay here and definitely will again. Thanks, Libby

review_text:
Absolutely perfect place for us! Exactly as delightful as described by the many other 5 star reviewers who've enjoyed Maebunny's.
Billie and Pippy, the small and the tall, are the friendliest dogs ever, but never pests. The shack had everything we needed and nothing we didn't, supremely clean, and the almost magical location: literally 5 minutes from downtown Durango, yet nestled within trees, birds, butterflies, with the sound of the water in the creek running behind the shack. Cars passing on the road mere whispers. The deep country experience just minutes from food, drink, rafting, etc.
Libby was low-key and friendly, responded to questions immediately, couldn't ask for a better host. We left a personal item behind and she was kind enough to mail it back to us.
I'd give 10 stars if I could. Would love to return!

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This was exactly what we expected. The bathroom has been updated to a porta-loo since the listing was created, which was a welcome improvement. If you stay here when it's cold at night just make sure you turn that space heater on asap! I unfortunately waited too long and was uncomfortable for longer than I needed to be. I arrived late at night and my son was already asleep so I didn't get to settle in before putting him in bed, and it was hard for me to find the heater under the circumstance. With that said, I do NOT recommend staying here if you might be arriving late at night. This is ideally a place you want to adapt to before night falls (like when you go camping!). All in all, I appreciated the accomodations and would certainly stay here again.

For a weekend getaway, it was exactly where we wanted to be- close to hot springs and Purgatory ski resort, Honeyville, and about a 15 minute drive from North City Market and friends in Durango. PJs Market in Hermosa is also a great place to pick up supplies (or in our case, our friend's birthday cake!). Cabin #3 was so cozy and pet friendly. It would be a family-friendly cabin as well. Great place to cook and sack out watch movies after a day of venturing in the local area. Loved the gas fireplace. It was an epic stay and we will certainly be back for more- her chateau would be great rain or shine!

With no AC, it gets very hot in the summer months and some windows were missing screens and other windows cannot open so limited ability for fresh air into the cabin. An extremely small fan was in a closet, but way too small to allow for any relief of the heat. Very disappointing and we did not stay. We rebooked immediately and found an amazing site just a few miles away. As of this posting, I have not received any refund since Vita seems to think itâ€™s up to Airbnb to decide this.

The cabin was cozy and just the right size for our family of 4. The kids had never seen the old school table arcade before and they though that was â€œsuper coolâ€. Kitchen was pretty well stocked. name: Amber And Johnathan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
February 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This place was really great for our family of 4 plus 1 doggo! I feel the need to tell every detail because we enjoyed it so much. First, the communication as outstanding. The day before we arrived, I asked if there was a grill. The property manager said he'd bring one over. There was a new grill waiting for us with grill utensils when we arrived. We were also sent exact coordinations to the house, but found it easily with the address. The house has a small fenced in back years that was perfect for our doggo. There is also what looks to be a garden in the summer that fascinated our 4 and 2 year olds. We'd love to come back when it's warmer and utilize fresh herbs or veggies! the bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. There was a small heater in the bedroom that warmed the space well, as it did get chilly at night! In the living room, there is a fireplace that I assume was gas. Very simple to turn on and off with a remote, and kept the whole cabin toasty. The kitchen was a small and efficient space, with a gas stove (which I love and prefer). We have young kids, so we really appreciated the sturdy and solid furniture, which was a beautiful wood. There were some really great touches in the cabin, including games, like Connect 4, several books, and, my husband's favorite, an arcade game with pac-man, Gallagher, dig out and others. There is also a washing machine that is a washer/dryer combo, which, to this point, I've only seen in Europe and South America. The space was very clean! Even my extremely picky husband commented on how clean it was. There was a locked closet that I assume had cleaning supplies in it, but we didn't have access, so if you want to clean up after yourself, plan to bring some disinfectant wipes. There is a really great deck on the front to enjoy the beautiful mountain scenery. While other houses are close by, the cabin does sit on a quiet back dirt road that was so nice to let the kids run on, and walk Teddy Roosevelt (the dog). As discussed in the description, you are exactly 12 miles to town, and apparently about the same to Purgatory, as the other rental property looked to have winter sporters staying. Easily a 5 star stay. My husband travels to Durango several times a year for work, and this will likely be our go-to whenever it's available!

Sarah even provided amenities for our fur baby, Max. The place had everything we needed, including a hot tub, games, foosball, cornhole, and a large TV with DVDs. Although we didn't use the ping pong table, the fire pit was perfect for roasting marshmallows and making Sâ€™mores (even during a heatwave). Downtown Durango was a short drive away, offering even more activities. It was a perfect retreat for our entire family, thanks to Sarah's exceptional hospitality and attention to detail.

review_text: Stunning views is right! You feel welcome right away, Sarah left friendly messages on dry erase boards by the front door and one near the kitchen. First of all the place was spotless inside, very orderly with plenty of room. The kitchen is finely updated and Sarah left us a welcome basket with snacks from local businesses, which we found to be really cool. We especially enjoyed the loose leaf tea. Also, thoughtfully, there were bottled waters for us which are very much needed when traveling to higher altitudes. The spacious deck off the back of the house has a neatly landscaped lighted pathway that leads to a hot tub. We soaked after dark and the star viewing was other worldly. The fire pit has an amazing back drop that made us feel we were far from any city. The king size bed in the main bedroom is extremely comfortable and the high thread count sheets were a nice touch, we slept like babies. Sarah came to say hello and was very friendly to us and our mini schnauzer.

review_text:
This was, by far, the best Airbnb experience I've ever had! My girlfriend and I decided to take a last-minute trip to Durango, and VERY fortunately stumbled upon Sarah's listing. After a long day of driving, we easily found the residence and followed really clear instructions (posted throughout the house) to get settled in. We immediately fell in love with the rustic surroundings and the spacious first floor (there were only two of us, but we want to bring kids back soon...PLENTY of room!), but the best part was upstairs.
We were greeted with a handwritten note from Sarah along with local tea, soap, beer, and chocolate, not to mention four eggs laid by the family's chickens! We loved every second of our stay, but the highlights were definitely the hot tub and the incredible firepit area where we had the unique pleasure of getting to know our hosts under a gorgeous night sky and around a warm fire. I could go on, but I'm out of space, so I'll end with this...thank you, Sarah!

review_text: This place is a perfect get away. Just close enough to town, but just far enough away to be alone. The master bed, lined in wood logs, was incredibly comfortable and located right off the kitchen and on the same level as the hot tub. Downstairs was the foosball table and Net-flicks on TV. Full kitchen so we cooked almost every night, breakfast every morning and made sandwiches each day for our trips out to adventure. We will definitely be back and will bring others with us! Top notch place!!!
